meanings.definition: Allowing liquid or gas to pass through a crack or hole.
meanings.sent1: The old bucket was leakier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The leakier pipe needed immediate repair.
meanings.sent3: The leakier faucet played a trick by spraying water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were leakier than a sieve.
meanings.sent5: The leakier roof dripped constantly during the storm.

meanings.definition: Having more leaks than something else.
meanings.sent1: The leakier boat needed constant bailing.
meanings.sent2: The leakier tire required frequent refilling.
meanings.sent3: The leakier umbrella decided to rain inside instead.
meanings.sent4: His leakier memory was like a sieve, forgetting important details.
